bug.title: Check for updates loop on Android TV version for Mi Box S
bug.body: Version: 1.4 for Android TV Download date: 29.12.2018. Android version: 8.1 #### Expected Behaviour <!-- What did you think the app was going to do? --> ... App would update or postpone update. #### Actual Behaviour <!-- What does the app do instead? --> ... App is stuck on screen where user has to select wether he wants to install update now or postpone it for later no matter what is selected. #### Steps to repoduce the behaviour <!-- What steps do we need to take to find the same bug that you found? --> 1. ... Open Preferences. 2. ... Click Check for updates. 3. ... If there is a new update, app asks wether to install it now or later. 4. ... Whatever you choose, app stays in loop and asks if you want to install it now or later again.

bug.title: Subtitles encoding problem for Czech
bug.body: Version: 0.2.9 Download date: 12.2.2017 Android version: 6.0 #### Expected Behaviour I expected that czech subtitles works correctly, but it did not, because Czech have letters Ž Ř etc. And in app it makes question mark (?) for this letters. #### Actual Behaviour Subtitles is showing question mark (?) for letters Ř, Ž, Š etc. I think bad here is bad encoding. #### Steps to repoduce the behaviour 1. Play movie that is available with Czech subtitles 2. You will see question mark in letters Ř Ž Š etc

bug.title: Internal player crash
bug.body: Version: 0.27 Download date: 05.30.2016 Android version: 5.0 Lollipop: #### Expected Behaviour Video player is going to play the whole video. #### Actual Behaviour Player stops reproduction up to 10s from start when watching shows. This is not happening with movies. When going back the whole app goes black and crash. #### Steps to repoduce the behaviour 1. Open app 2. Navigate to shows 3. Play a show (I chose Game of Thrones) 4. Play on internal player 5. Wait up to 10s 6. Player freezes 7. Try going back 8. App crashes

bug.title: Menu button is unreachable
bug.body: Version: 0.2.8 (latest) Download date: Android version: 6.0.1 The on-screen buttons overlap the menu button which is unreachable, unclickable. I guess you get this bug only on on-screen buttons devices (I'm on a Nexus 6P atm).

bug.title: Weird thing is happening with subtitle time settings
bug.body: When the subtitle timing is set to a negative number such as -15 or something. It works good. But, when the timing settings is opened again to reconfigure the timing, it somehow jumps to a big negative number starting with the first two integers that was first set. Like -1500... **For Example** I set it to -16 initially... ![screenshot_2016-02-28-16-33-46](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11281452/13378958/989b39c0-de39-11e5-887a-fbfd9d0443bb.png) and when I opened it again, it jumped to a big negative number. ![screenshot_2016-02-28-16-34-05](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11281452/13378956/80299ed6-de39-11e5-842f-81ae9466c305.png)
